author: Edward Jane
title: Crowdano Crowdfunding Platform
description: Backers of a crowdfunding campaign should be able to ensure their funds are used correctly, however 9% of Kickstarters fail to deliver\[1\]\[2\]

assessments.note: Building a crowdfunding platform with accountability features on Cardano is a great way to drive adoption.

Trustlessness is certainly useful component in crowdfunding but I feel this proposal misses the decentralised component and replicates instead legacy business model missing out on P2P components of Cardano swarm supports already available through the work of the Foundation and Catalyst. I would like to see more creativity in determining 'funding' values and encourage team forming around proposed projects such as IdeaScale and collaborations on the crowd supported projects.

The proposal appears to meet the challenge criteria in that will over time produce a Dapp. I am inclined to query the plan and budget aspects. It would benefit greatly from more detail about initial steps and team building aspects.

The proposal if successful would attract participants to an ADA centered economy.  It has the potential to grow transactions and token usage. If successful in attracting participants and gaining trust, the volume of ADA involved could be large.
Great idea to have milestones to release payments via a smart contract.

This is a great concept with huge potential interest.  Also a great name!
The potential for driving adoption is high, and this solution would contribute to democratized innovation, which is of value.
Some suggestions for future consideration:
- the funding / smart contract protocols 
   and the associated process become a 
   differentiating factor for this platform 
   (vs. Kickstarter).  This may be part of the 
   prototyping:  how can you use the capabilities
   of smart contracts to allow the funders to have
   unique influence or to get increased "stake" or
   return over several phases of the project-to-be
   -funded?  Be prepared to evolve over time.
-  Governance function is currently focused on the 
    governance of Crowdano.  Would suggest this
    is a lower priority for initial releases and 
    focus should be on the "funder's" influence
    on the "funded project"s phased evolution.
This project address the need for having a crowdsource funding run on smart contract to increase the trust between project backers and the project owners.
As the proposer is a plutus pioneer with relevant development experience and accounts for outside help, a moderate success prediction is justified.

Yes I believe that this Plutus pioneer could replicate existing crowd funding principles and with the help of the community save most of his costs in marketing however I don't like that he is completely forgoing his fees and would prefer to see him collaborate with Catalyst team developing components of Cardano onboarding within the existing community systems and in continuation to them.

I believe the proposer has good skills yet am concerned that he is working alone and does not describe hiring further developers. This appears to be a large project and would benefit from a collaborative approach.

Feasibility: 4/5
The proposer has relevant developer experience and is a Plutus pioneer with early testnet access. The project goals and costs are focused, well-defined, and effectively communicated.  The professional attitude towards the presentation of the proposal shows that a lot of work has gone into developing the concept up to this point. It is one of the more feasible proposals I have come across so far.  I only question if enough funds have been allocated to Legal Council and Marketing.  As long as a viable product is produced, future funding rounds could address this.

Slightly ironic for a proposal which is based on releasing funds vs milestones to not have detailed milestones themselves. This raises the issue on whether they fully understand the problem. How will you gather and validate the information for the smart contracts to release funds?

The specific outcome is not clearly described and so success is difficult to measure.

I would suggest a more limited and clear MVP (e.g. a prototype with a single fundraising campaign and no governance?).  

Be prepared to enhance Crowdano through several funding rounds, and iterate ideas through expanding prototypes.
The proposer seems to have the necessary toolset to complete the work, however being a single developer with an ambitious timeline, it might be a little risky.
By adding info on top of well understood crowdfunding platforms, the proposal is concise while providing sufficient information (features to build, budget breakdown).
Yes the information about feasible work package components seems very feasible although insufficiently decentralised or peer collaboration empowering in my view.

The proposal certainly has support from the community and over time it may well be developed. The information provided is reasonable but would benefit from greater detail. It appears to be at the research phase rather than the ready for submission stage although I sense with the correct connections this could be addressed quite quickly.

Auditability: 4/5
Goals are well defined and auditable. It should be possible to verify that funding has gone to the indicated topics. The number and ADA size of campaigns in the months following release will allow for an assessment of the return on intention.
Proposal needs a more detailed plan to be able to asses feasibility. Milestones, budget etc. Same as they would be imposing within their project.

The outline of resources is well-thought out and reasonable.

Without a high level development, testing and implementation roadmap, it is difficult to audit progress.  The state outcomes need to be more specific in order to gauge the success of the proposal.

A more specific an limited MVP would make for a more successful proposal.

There's a brief overview of what the proposal milestones for each phases all the way through the end of the year. It's not obvious however how would the proposer plan to accomplish getting 50 campaigns active in 6 months after completion. Will there be a partnership with existing crowdfunding platform?

solution: I propose a crowdfunding platform based on Cardano which implements a staged-funding model to protect backer's investments.
